Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery oinochoe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting possibly of deer (forelegs remaining) to right; large blob below lost belly; black band below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink 'NAU 19' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 79, NAU19), the sherd's provenance could be Chios, but must remain uncertain, given the fabric's high levels of potassium and aluminum.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78-79, 82-83, fig. 1) (Nau 19)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.656)
